channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lightning Rod on Chapel fell off, 2nd December
item.description:
The lightning rod on the wooden spire of the chapel in London Road Cemetery has come away in the recent winds. Please don’t leave for too long as it protects the building from being directly struck and fire. The spire being wood shouldn’t be too hard to reattach. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warner Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous, 2nd December
item.description:
I accept it was partially my thought I was in the hurry but I don't expect the pavement to be slippery with squash berries why has the council allowed the tree to be planted like that on a pavement area so can it please be cleaned up

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Woodlands Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches need pruning, 2nd December
item.description:
The branches now meet with the tree on the other side of the road outside no.62. It is just too big especially in high winds. The one outside 63 is biggest.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homemead Road, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Leaves on pavement, 2nd December
item.description:
Thus pavement has not been cleaned and the wet leaves have made walking a hazard. For a person with walking difficulties its dangerous and I have to walk in the road to avoid falling

item.title: Failure to properly contain waste, 2nd December
item.description:
Persistent failure to control household waste to the extent it migrates to the public’s highway and damages the street scene. In contravention of: Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005 Reason Envirocrime that damages the street scene Place your waste or trade waste in a public litter bin or do not ensure that your waste is properly contained.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing bracket on door at titmuss avenue, 2nd December
item.description:
Hello please could the entrance door at number 7-47 be fixed as soon as possible as it is currently not closing when residents are entering of leaving the building as the door arm bracket above the door is missing. The address is... Titmuss avenue 7 to 47 Thamesmead London SE28

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Titmuss Avenue, Thamesmead
